item.title: Galatians 6
item.description: Brothers need to restore each other in gentleness should any of them sin. Furthermore, while they share each other’s burdens, they must keep in mind that they are held accountable to their own work.

item.title: Galatians 5
item.description: Christ set us free so we could have freedom, so do not return back to slavery. Paul, a Jew, tells them to not accept circumcision.

item.title: Galatians 4
item.description: While the heir is a child, his rights are that of a slave. Likewise, we were slaves of the world while we were still children.

item.title: Galatians 3
item.description: For the Galatians in the church, they were there as witnesses to the public crucifixion of Christ. Yet, the Spirit was given to them because of faith.

item.title: Galatians 2
item.description: Paul returned to Jerusalem with Barnabas and Titus after 14 years. The purpose of his visit was to ensure that the gospel he had been preaching among the Gentiles was correct.

item.title: Galatians 1
item.description: Letter was written 49-50 AD 1 Written during the time of Emperor Claudius 2 Jews would have just been expelled from Rome sometime between 41 and 50 AD 3 This letter was written by the apostle Paul to the churches of Galatia.
